conversations.value: Student: If I remember correctly, in simple harmonic motion, the acceleration is always directed towards the fixed point of equilibrium and is directly proportional to the displacement from that point. The proportionality constant is the square of the angular frequency of the oscillations. So, the equation should look like a = -ω^2 * x. But I'm not sure how to apply this condition to the given options.

By re-writing the equation in this form, it becomes easier to compare this with the given relationships.
